thread.title_full: These Adobe Apps Can Put Your Data At Risk, Indian Government Issues Alert: Check Full List, What To Do Next

author: @TIMESNOW
title: These Adobe Apps Can Put Your Data At Risk, Indian Government Issues Alert: Check Full List, What To Do Next
text:
Technology & Science
These Adobe Apps Can Put Your Data At Risk, Indian Government Issues Alert: Check Full List, What To Do Next
CERT-In has issued a crucial advisory regarding serious vulnerabilities in numerous Adobe products, potentially allowing hackers to execute harmful code, steal sensitive information, or crash systems.
CERT-In has issued a crucial advisory regarding serious vulnerabilities in numerous Adobe products
The Indian Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT-In) has released a high-priority security advisory (CIVN-2025-0173) warning about multiple critical vulnerabilities in a wide range of Adobe products. Issued on August 13, 2025, the alert states that these flaws could allow hackers to bypass security controls, execute malicious code, steal sensitive data, or even crash systems entirely, here's everything you need to know.
Which Adobe Products Are Affected?
The list of impacted software is extensive and includes widely used creative, design and business tools:Adobe Commerce: Versions 2.4.9-alpha1, 2.4.8-p1 and earlier, 2.4.7-p6 and earlier, down to 2.4.4-p14 and earlier.
Adobe Commerce B2B: Versions 1.5.3-alpha1, 1.5.2-p1 and earlier, 1.4.2-p6 and earlier, and older releases.
Magento Open Source: Versions 2.4.9-alpha1 through 2.4.5-p13 and earlier.
Adobe Substance 3D Suite: Viewer (0.25 and earlier), Modeler (1.22.0 and earlier), Painter (11.0.2 and earlier), Sampler (5.0.3 and earlier), and Stager (3.1.3 and earlier).
Adobe Animate: 2023 (23.0.12 and earlier) and 2024 (24.0.09 and earlier) for Windows and macOS.
Adobe Illustrator: 2025 (29.6.1 and earlier) and 2024 (28.7.8 and earlier) for Windows and macOS.
Adobe Photoshop: 2025 (26.8 and earlier) and 2024 (25.12.3 and earlier) for Windows and macOS.
Adobe InDesign: ID20.4 and earlier, ID19.5.4 and earlier.
Adobe InCopy: 20.4 and earlier, 19.5.4 and earlier.
Adobe FrameMaker: 2020 Release Update 8 and earlier, 2022 Release Update 6 and earlier (Windows).
Adobe Dimension: Version 4.1.3 and earlier for Windows and macOS.
Whatâ€™s The Risk?
According to CERT-In, these vulnerabilities could lead to:Remote Code Execution: Hackers could run malicious programs on your device.
Privilege Escalation: Attackers might gain higher access rights than intended.
Sensitive Data Theft: Private files and information could be exposed.
Denial Of Service (DoS): Your system could become unstable or crash completely.
How To Protect Yourself
The simplest fix is to update your Adobe software immediately. Open your app, check for any available updates, install them and restart your PC or laptop. This will ensure you have the latest security patches.Get
